pros: Flexible schedule, Friendly staff, Understanding mangament

review_title: Good place to work as a nurse
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Blairsville, GA
pros: They take care of their nurses. In general, you're not overworked and they pay attention to your patient load. When I worked there, the charge nurses did not take patients and usually there was an assistant charge as well, and a unit secretary. An effort is made to make sure there are enough CNA's on the floor, and they are good at what they do. The docs do not dis-respect the nurses. (At my previous hospital, they eliminated the unit admins, and the charges had to take a full patient load, the CNA's were limited on the floor, and unfortunately they mostly hung around the nurses station flirting with the docs leaving the nurses to hand out meal trays, change beds, etc.) Unlike most community hospitals, they haven't been taken over by a mega-hospital corporation, or by a private equity fund. Hospital is growing, building new facilities, and adding services.
cons: It's a rural community hospital, so they don't have advanced cardiac, neuro-trauma, or high acuity ICU facilities. They don't pay as much as in a larger metro area like Atlanta, or Asheville, but they give yearly raises and pay OK for the area.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Blairsville, GA
pros: Small hospital, work with great people
cons: No accountability, if you ha e worked anywhere else you will be bored. No protocols, Dr. Do not take suggestions for pt care it's their way or no way, uses out dated practices No best practice in site. You wo t be able to grow unless your someone's long time close friend or family.

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Blairsville, GA
pros: They treat you great, great company to work for.
cons: There is hourly shift difs for CNA but not ED. The hourly are still low. Pay is just low.

pros: Great boss, coworkers helpful, family feel
cons: Management appears greedy. Not enough raises or bonuses to their hard working staff, yet they receive vehicles to drive, nice gifts, great bonuses.

pros: Fun job, fun and supportive management
cons: I really have no cons to mention

pros: This hospital is supposedly based on a community model and attempts to be active in the local community.
cons: The hospital appears to "cheap out" in many areas and falls miles behind other hospitals in the state regarding employee compensation, benefits, and PTO and appears to be making no visible strides in changing this fact.

cons:
Losing focus on providing care for individuals and community with the pandemic 
Employee burnout and turnover are high, esp at management levels
Poorly run unit by Nurse Manager. Unsafe assignments. High turnover. Floating required to other units.

pros: Steady work, can work lots of overtime. Differentials for nights, weekends, and holidays. Small taxable bonus at end of year.
cons: PTO cash out heavily taxed. Scheduling for FT is terrible. Pay is poor compared to everything else nearby.

pros: The hospital staff are like family and treat you like family. Good place to work, but you work! Staff is helpful and friendly.
cons: Sometimes the shifts are not the greatest. You tend to miss family sometimes because if you want hours they are there.

review_title: Nice place of work, very good hospital for a community settings
pros: Very good place to work if you like country environment. Nice and hospital people. Very laid-back community, perfect for retiring professionals, above average community hospital.
cons: Salary is relatively lower compare to other places in Georgia. Not suitable if you urbanized environment. Cost of living is not so great too.

pros: Friendly, helpful staff. Great vacation & time off benefits. Decent pay - plus generous shift & holiday differentials. Easy going, laid back work place.
cons: It being a hospital, the only downside is catching a cold or getting sick but comes with the environment.

job_title: Responsable De Zone Ile-de-France Grands Comptes in Blairsville, GA
pros: Great teamwork, helicopter and ambulance associates with facility for rapid transport to a higher level of care
cons: Low pay despite years of experience. Moved from Florida making close to $45/ hr- making $31 with shift diff etc

pros: None that I can think of
cons: Employees do not get  a raise after 10 years of employment. Instead they get a "bonus" that is taxed heavily. The newer nurses hired at higher entry rates often surpass the salaries of the long term nursing (or any department) staff.
